definition: to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
seasoned/honed to perfection over centuries/special reserve
I've admired your reputation for a long time (idiom); I've been looking forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.

sentences.english: Changchun Light technology institute is China most early and most has the great reputation optics development facility.
sentences.chinese: 长春光机所是中国最早和最负盛名的光学研究机构。

sentences.english: Rice noodles are the most famous snack in Guilin.
sentences.chinese: 米粉是桂林久负盛名的小吃。

sentences.english: He’s perhaps the most well-known painter from all of the 20:th century.
sentences.chinese: 他或许是近一个世纪以来最负盛名的艺术家。

sentences.english: The most prestigious should be "usual broad Bodhisattva" and the depositary of Buddhist texts.
sentences.chinese: 最负盛名的应该是“露齿菩萨”和藏经阁。

sentences.english: Purple garlic of Ying county is famous with its quality.
sentences.chinese: 山西省应县的紫皮大蒜在国内久负盛名。

sentences.english: The city has long been noted for its perfume industry. Population, 24,553.
sentences.chinese: 该市因其香水工业而久负盛名。

sentences.english: Besides, the Taohuawu wood engraving Spring Festival pictures also enjoy great reputation.
sentences.chinese: 此外，桃花坞的木刻年画也享有盛名。

sentences.english: Toru Takemitsu is one of Asia's celebrated composers of the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 武满彻是20世纪亚洲最富盛名的作曲家之一。

sentences.english: Huang Zongzhi is one of the most famous legal historian.
sentences.chinese: 黄宗智先生是当代最负盛名的法律史学家。

sentences.english: He is, without any question, the best known writer Denmark has ever produced.
sentences.chinese: 他无疑是丹麦史所产生的最负盛名的作家。

sentences.english: Rice noodles are the most famous snack in Guilin.
sentences.chinese: 米粉是桂林久负盛名的小吃。

sentences.english: The implosion of America's most storied investment banks.
sentences.chinese: 美国最负盛名的几家投资银行破产。

sentences.english: In fact, the venerable BlackBerry is currently in a “tweener” stage.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，久负盛名的黑莓目前处在了“中间”阶段。

sentences.english: The 20-year-old is a sophomore at the prestigious Royal College of Music in London.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他在久负盛名的伦敦皇家音乐学院就读二年级。

sentences.english: Perhaps his best-known creation was the National Congress building in Brasilia , the capital.
sentences.chinese: 他最负盛名的作品是为在巴西里亚的巴西议会大厦。

sentences.english: In the early days of Tang Dynasty, litchi had won the title of delicacy.
sentences.chinese: 早在唐初，荔枝已属享有盛名之美味。
